definition: Shide, Tang Buddhist poet who lived at the Guoqing Temple on Mt Tiantai 天台山[Tian1 tai1 Shan1]
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: Originally, collect in temple to administer the fragrant light of dining room.
sentences.chinese: 起初，拾得在寺內掌管食堂香燈。

sentences.english: Article 109 A lost-and-found object shall be returned to the right holder.
sentences.chinese: 第一百零九條拾得遺失物，應當返還權利人。

sentences.english: I did steadily pick up some crumbs of knowledge .
sentences.chinese: 我還是持續不斷地拾得了一點學問的餘瀝。

sentences.english: The stipulation of lost property in the Civil Law of our country is too simple and general.
sentences.chinese: 我國民法通則對拾得制度的規定過於簡略。

sentences.english: He gave the boy a reward of ￡5 for finding his lost watch.
sentences.chinese: 他給拾得他手錶的那個男孩賞金5英鎊。

sentences.english: Shih-te was a poet too but he never wrote much down.
sentences.chinese: 拾得也是一個詩人但他寫下來的不多。

sentences.english: Article 109 A person who finds a lost thing shall return it to the obligee.
sentences.chinese: 第一百零九條拾得遺失物，應當返還權利人。

definition: to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
(of income etc) to be unassured/to lack a reliable source
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to snap off (flowers, leaves, twigs etc from a tree or shrub)
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
